intro: Cymodocea ciliata, commonly known as the hairy seagrass, is a marine flowering plant belonging to the family Posidoniaceae. It is characterized by its long, ribbon-like leaves that are covered in fine, hair-like structures, giving it its common name. This species is typically found in shallow coastal waters, where it forms dense underwater meadows. Cymodocea ciliata plays an important role in marine ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various marine organisms. It is also used in some traditional practices and has potential applications in biotechnology.
